title: Basic Async/Await
instructions:
Write an async function `fetchUserData(userId)` that simulates fetching user data. It should return a Promise that resolves after 100ms with an object: { id: userId, name: 'User' + userId }

Example: fetchUserData(5) should resolve to { id: 5, name: 'User5' }

hints.content: An async function can return a Promise. Use setTimeout to simulate a delay.
Return a new Promise that uses setTimeout for 100ms, then resolves with an object containing id and name properties.
Use: `return new Promise((resolve) => { setTimeout(() => { resolve({ id: userId, name: 'User' + userId }); }, 100); });`
